text: Clarence Frank Buck (June 6, 1870 - September 2, 1944) was an American politician, businessman, and farmer. ==Biography== Buck was born in Monmouth, Illinois. He graduated from Monmouth College. He was a farmer and rased livestock. Buck serve as editor of the Monmouth Daily Atlas newspaper. Buck was involved with the Republican Party and served as postmaster for Monmouth. He was also involved with the banking business. Buck served in the Illinois Senate from 1919 to 1925. Buck died at his home in Monmouth, Illinois.Illinois Blue Book 1923-124, Biographical Sketch of Clarence F. title: Clarence F. Buck
